jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About the job
Job Title: Data Analyst/Scientist
Location: EU Remote, flying in once every 1.5-2 months
Contract Type: Contract until the end of the year (+potential extensions)
Hourly Rate: 30-39 EUR/hr
Start Date: Candidates must be able to start by the 1st of July latest

The client:
A global leader in cybersecurity specialising in safeguarding digital assets and ensuring adherence to industry standards. They provide adaptable security solutions designed to address various challenges faced by major organisations and public institutions.

The ideal candidate will have effective communication, demonstrated collaboration, and strong sense of ownership from analysis to implementation ‚Äì particularly the ability to distil complex analytical research into clear, actionable insights and partner with the team to implement solutions effectively.

Tech Stack:
Proficient in Python, R, SQL
Data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Grafana.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure)

What you will do:
Lead initiatives to design and implement advanced analytics, machine learning and AI solutions that elevate the quality, structure, consistency, and strategic value of data within the product.
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable data science solutions. Effectively communicate insights through well-structured reports, intuitive dashboards, and compelling presentations tailored to both technical and non-technical audiences, including senior leadership.
Design and develop tools that support efficient data analysis and facilitate clear communication with stakeholders.
Partner with stakeholders to define metrics and KPIs to track progress, and communicate results.

This is a unique chance to be part of a transformational initiative for a leading tech client. If you have the skills, ambition, and mindset to drive automation and remediation in a dynamic setting, apply today and be part of a high-impact team tackling cutting-edge challenges.

jobs.title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
jobs.description:
About the job
You're not just looking for a new role ‚Äî you want to build data infrastructure that directly improves customer outcomes. As our first Customer Success hire with a data focus, you'll be the bridge between raw customer data and actionable insights. You'll take ownership of extracting, cleaning, and structuring complex datasets from various sources to support seamless onboarding, usage monitoring, and value delivery. Using Python and analytics tools, you'll turn messy data into clear signals ‚Äî enabling smarter customer engagement and scalable success processes. Your work will define how we operationalize Customer Success and set the foundation for long-term customer impact.

Key Responsibilities üéØ

 Own technical onboarding - Own the full data setup for new customers, including extraction, ETL, and integration of formats like CSV, JSON, XML, and geodata (e.g. KML, SHP)
 Build scalable data workflows - Use AI tools & Python to automate key processes
 Bridge tech and customer needs - Translate operational and IT requirements into smooth integrations, including with systems like SAP or GIS-systems
 Communicate with clarity - Build trust across all levels by pairing technical expertise with strong, empathetic communication


This role is right for you if... ‚ú®

You're a tech-savvy problem solver who thrives on turning messy data into clean, usable formats
You're comfortable writing scripts, building data pipelines, and navigating complex file formats and APIs 
You enjoy working directly with customers ‚Äî not just to support them, but to deeply understand their technical constraints and solve them collaboratively 
You love structure, automation, and scalable solutions ‚Äî and constantly seek to use newest AI tools 
You're self-driven, curious, and excited to take full ownership of implementation and data integration projects 
You are motivated by the opportunity to make a positive impact on the planet üåç


Requirements


Skills & experience you will need üí™

Prior experience in a technical customer-facing role like in consulting 
Hands-on experience with data conversion, ETL pipelines and strong Excel skills 
Solid Python scripting skills for automation and data transformation 
Experience with AI tools to accelerate workflows 
Fluent in both English and German 


Nice-to-haves üçí

Experience with geospatial data formats like KML or SHP
Familiarity with SQL for querying and manipulating datasets 
Familiarity with enterprise systems like SAP and GIS-systems and in managing enterprise stakeholders


Benefits

 Remote Working: Work from our hubs in Hamburg or Munich, or remote from Germany
 Unlimited Vacation: Take as many holidays as you need ‚Äî we trust you to recharge when it matters most
 Flexible Working Hours: Work during the hours that align with your peak performance and lifestyle
 Mental Health Matters: Access 1:1 psychologist sessions and workshops through our Bloom partnership
 Professional Growth: Use a dedicated development budget to enhance your skills and career
 Stock Option Plan: Receive virtual stocks as a reward for your trust, effort, and vision alignment
 Unite, Recharge, Celebrate: Join in-person team retreats to connect and have fun
 Explore Germany: Enjoy the Deutschlandticket for flexible public transportation access

jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About the job
About Taskify
Taskify is a leading-edge technology company dedicated to revolutionizing productivity and organization for individuals and teams worldwide. Our intuitive platform empowers users to effortlessly manage projects, collaborate seamlessly, and achieve their goals with unparalleled efficiency. We believe that clarity and simplicity are the keys to unlocking potential, and our mission is to build tools that transform how people work and live. Join us in shaping the future of productivity!

The Opportunity: Data Analyst
At Taskify, data is at the heart of every decision we make. We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Data Analyst to join our growing team in the U.S. (Remote-friendly). In this role, you will be instrumental in transforming complex data into actionable insights, directly influencing product development, marketing strategies, and overall business growth. You will uncover trends, identify opportunities, and help us understand our users better, ultimately enhancing the Taskify experience for millions.

What You'll Do (Responsibilities)
Perform In-depth Analysis: Conduct rigorous analysis of product usage data, user behavior patterns, feature adoption rates, and customer lifecycle metrics to identify key trends and insights.
Develop & Maintain Reporting: Design, build, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to user engagement, task completion, project efficiency, and revenue.
Support Business Decisions: Work closely with product managers, marketing specialists, engineering teams, and senior leadership to understand their data needs, provide ad-hoc analysis, and translate complex findings into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations.
Ensure Data Quality: Clean, transform, and validate large datasets from various sources (e.g., relational databases, internal APIs, third-party platforms) to ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability.
Quantify Impact: Assist in designing and analyzing A/B tests and other experiments to measure the impact of new features, marketing campaigns, and product changes.
Communicate Insights: Present findings and insights to diverse audiences, effectively communicating technical details to non-technical stakeholders through compelling narratives and visualizations.
Collaborate on Data Infrastructure: Partner with data engineers and software engineers to define data tracking requirements, improve data pipelines, and ensure robust data infrastructure.
Promote Data Literacy: Advocate for data-driven decision-making across the organization and help foster a culture of curiosity and continuous learning around data.

What You'll Bring (Qualifications) Required:
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business Analytics, or a related discipline.
3+ years of professional experience as a Data Analyst, preferably within a SaaS, tech, or product-driven environment.
Expert proficiency in SQL for querying, manipulating, and analyzing large datasets.
Strong experience with at least one leading data visualization tool (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Google Data Studio) to create impactful dashboards and reports.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, complex formulas) for data manipulation and analysis.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
Proven ability to translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Preferred:
Master's degree in a relevant quantitative field.
Proficiency in a scripting language for data analysis (e.g., Python with Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, or R).
Experience with statistical analysis (e.g., hypothesis testing, regression analysis).
Familiarity with cloud data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, Google BigQuery, Amazon Redshift).
Experience with ETL processes and data pipeline concepts.
Prior experience analyzing user behavior data for a web or mobile application.

Why You'll Love Working at Taskify
Make a Real Impact: Your work will directly influence the development of a product used by millions, helping them be more productive and achieve their goals.
Innovative Environment: Be part of a fast-paced, forward-thinking company that values innovation and continuous improvement.
Collaborative Culture: Work alongside a passionate and supportive team of talented professionals who are eager to learn and grow together.
Growth Opportunities: We are committed to your professional development and offer opportunities for learning, mentorship, and career advancement.
Competitive Compensation & Benefits: We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) matching, generous paid time off, and flexible remote work options.

Ready to Taskify Your Career?
If you are a curious, data-driven individual who loves to solve problems and contribute to a product that truly makes a difference, we encourage you to apply! Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you're excited about this opportunity at Taskify.
Taskify is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

jobs.title: MRI Physicist - Modelling & Optimisation
jobs.description:
About the job


What we do

The development of new physics based hardware technologies is often a challenging task bottle-necked by the speed of iterating between different generations of design prototypes. We are gathering the brightest minds to solve this! Join us on our journey to become the world‚Äôs leading scientific machine learning company, building software that provides data driven control, calibration and characterisation tools for a broad range of physics-based R&D applications. We work remotely, and meet physically once a month for planning, brainstorming and shared meals.
Specifically for our magnetic resonance product, we are building an integrated software stack to model the devices, design the pulse sequences for high contrast imaging under RF control bandwidth and magnetic field constraints, and then to calibrate the devices in a closed-loop optimization. Our unique differentiable digital twin can also use advanced Machine Learning algorithms to update the model to account for discrepancies between the experiment and the model-predicted behavior.


Why we need you

As we build the tools to help scientists better calibrate & characterise their hardware, we need a team of scientists that both understand the pains of MRI scientists in the lab trying to design new pulse sequences and the advantage that software & automation services can bring to this process. We are developing powerful numerical simulation and inverse modelling tools and it is crucial that you feel comfortable in speaking (and translating between) the languages spoken by theoreticians, experimental scientists and engineers.

Your profile

Strong background in magnetic resonance technologies such as MRI / NMR / EPR (PhD or MSc with equivalent experience) is required
Experience in numerical modelling of magnetic resonance processes and / or optimization of NMR / MRI pulse sequences is required
Experience in working with experimental systems or collaborating closely with experimental research groups is preferred
You must enjoy scientific programming and building software systems, and be willing to learn necessary tools and techniques for developing industry grade software
You must already reside or be willing to relocate near EU time-zones (CET¬±1)


What we need for your application

Your CV is a good start. But, what we‚Äôd really like to see is that you have a proven track record of projects and work in the relevant field. So if you can send us a link to your GitHub, recent projects or real-world examples of what you have done so far, that is what really interests us. Before a possible interview, please think about the following:
What is something you accomplished which you are really proud of?
What technological developments are you excited about?
What are the things that you have taught yourself?
What is something you would like to learn or improve in the near future?


Perks & benefits

30 days of paid vacation a year
Remote work by default
Choose your own work computer
Budget for home office equipment
Flexible working hours
Travel / Co-working space cost reimbursement
Regular company-paid team-events


About us

Qruise creates algorithmic and ML tools to accelerate the development of quantum computers and other quantum technologies. We're an international and diverse team, with most of us located in Germany.

jobs.title: Imprint - Computational Immunologist/ Machine Learning Scientist/ Biostatistician
jobs.description:
About the job
IMPRINT is a biomedical Focused Research Organization (FRO) studying the hidden causes of chronic disease, especially autoimmune and psychiatric disorders. Our work involves cutting-edge research at the intersection of immunology, neuroscience, and behavior.

We are looking for a Computational Biologist/Machine Learning Scientist/Biostatistician with experience in the computational modeling and analysis of large-scale biological datasets, preferably with expertise in structural models or experience in user interactions. The successful candidate will develop novel mathematical, simulation, and machine-learning methods to advance the understanding of adaptive immune receptor repertoires. You will work closely with other computational and experimental scientists to develop groundbreaking new insights into adaptive immunity.

It would be ideal for the candidate to be based in Germany or elsewhere in Europe, since the majority of the computational team is based there, but we are open to exceptional candidates in the US and Canada.

Primary Responsibilities

Develop mathematical, computational, and machine learning approaches for modeling large-scale immune receptor sequence and/or structural data
Develop novel simulation frameworks for immune repertoire analysis
Perform deep and detailed analyses for data-intensive experiments
Prepare large-scale datasets for internal and external usage
Expand own knowledge base with new methods and concepts to tackle evolving research questions and demands for collaboration

Qualifications

Ph.D. in computational biology, physics, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or related fields is required
Proven track record of developing computational analyses for biological data
Background in machine learning
Proficiency with Python, associated analyses and visualization packages, as well as command line
Proficiency in high-performance computing
Proficiency with good practices for reproducible research (git, Jupyter)

Preferred Qualifications

Expertise with sc-RNAseq data
Expertise in immunology
Expertise in immune receptor biology and data analysis
Expertise in structural models
Experience with cloud computing platforms
Experience with Docker
Experience with user interactions

Benefits

Competitive compensation: $90,000 - $120,000 a year (salary commensurate with relevant experience and adjusted for location)
Excellent medical, dental, and vision insurance for US- based candidates; benefits for INTL employees vary by country
Generous time off + paid holidays
A supportive environment to learn and develop new skills
An opportunity to participate in high-impact, fast-paced, cutting-edge, collaborative team science; contribute to curing disease; and work with leading experts from different fields
The opportunity to contribute to scientific publications

Location

Work remotely or hybrid from within Europe or the US, depending on candidate location. Will require international travel as needed for team meetings and other business purposes. 

$90,000 - $120,000 a year

jobs.title: Data Analyst (Trading)
jobs.description:
About the job
About the Role
As a Data Analyst, your primary responsibility is to analyze trading transactions, client data, and key business metrics to support team and organizational decision-making. You will work closely with Risk Management and Trading Engineers to leverage data-driven insights that enhance trading strategies, optimize system parameters, and prevent system exploitation.
Your work will involve analyzing trade flow, execution performance, and market impact to identify inefficiencies and detect abnormal behaviors. This includes activities related to both risk management and system performance enhancement. The insights derived from your analysis will serve as evidence-based foundations for developing strategies and solving problems effectively.
Your contributions will have a direct impact on business operations, making you an essential part of the company's success.

üöÄ What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Data Extraction, Cleaning, and Analysis
Extract data from databases, clean and preprocess user or trading data, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data supports strategic initiatives.
Trade Data Analysis
Examine and analyze trading data to identify patterns, trends, and investment opportunities.
Decision Support
Provide analytical insights and data-driven recommendations to support business decision-making processes.
Process Improvement
Develop and enhance data analysis workflows to improve efficiency, accuracy, and reliability of data outputs.
Reporting and Exploratory Analysis
Produce ad-hoc reports and perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support strategic planning and operational decisions.
Risk Data Analysis and Monitoring
Analyze large datasets to assist in the team‚Äôs risk management efforts. Responsibilities include creating and maintaining risk reports and dashboards to monitor various risk types‚Äîsuch as credit risk, liquidity risk, and market risk‚Äîand track their status within the business.
Emerging Risk Identification and Strategic Risk Projects
Work closely with the Risk Management team to identify emerging or evolving risks that may impact the organization. You may also be assigned special risk analysis projects as needed.
Provide data to analyze trading behavior
Analyze data to identify and investigate toxic flow, arbitrage activities, high-frequency trading (HFT), scalping, sniping, and abnormal usage of Expert Advisors (EAs) in order to mitigate risk and safeguard the integrity of trading operations.
Provide data to optimize Execution Performance
Monitor and analyze metrics such as order book dynamics, trade volume, fill ratios, liquidity depth, slippage, and requotes to enhance execution quality and trading efficiency.
Evaluate Liquidity Providers (LPs) through data extraction and analysis to assess their performance and reliability.
Assess the performance of liquidity providers using quantitative methods and develop interactive, data-driven dashboards to support strategic decision-making.
Support Risk and Trading Teams
Generate insightful reports related to toxic trading patterns, latency, and spread behavior.
Collaborate with the Risk Management team to develop risk models and implement real-time alert systems for identifying and responding to abnormal trading activities.
Design and implement rule-based or machine learning models to detect abnormal trading behavior. Deploy real-time alert systems to flag irregular activities, and evaluate the impact of macroeconomic events on market dynamics.


üéØ What We‚Äôre Looking For

A Bachelor's degree or higher in a relevant field such as Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Science, or Computer Science.
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in data analysis is required.
Proven ability to generate Toxic Trading Pattern Reports within 24 hours of detection.
Demonstrated success in improving trade surveillance model accuracy by at least 30%.
Experience in enhancing order execution analysis to minimize system vulnerabilities and exploitation.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Skilled in SQL and database management for querying and handling large datasets.
Proficiency in Python or R for advanced statistical and analytical modeling.
Strong competency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Previous experience in financial markets, particularly in CFD or Forex industries.
Strong understanding of trading systems and financial products.
Familiarity with digital products and a genuine interest in trading or investment markets is considered a strong advantage.
Candidates with experience in Big Data Analytics, advanced Python programming, and high-level SQL skills will be given special consideration.

Additional Qualifications & Attributes:
Strong ability in data modeling and statistical analysis.
Strong knowledge of statistics and mathematics for trend analysis and hypothesis testing.
High attention to detail with the ability to work effectively under pressure.
Strong interest in financial markets and excellent analytical thinking skills.
Advanced mathematical abilities and a systematic approach to problem-solving.
Disciplined, punctual, and able to work well in a collaborative team environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly explain complex technical analyses to team members and senior management, as well as effectively solve analytical problems.
Strong data analytical capabilities, including the ability to gather and integrate data from multiple structured and unstructured sources, and synthesize actionable insights.


üí° Why Join IUX?

‚úÖ Permanent Role & Career Growth: Join as an executive today, and you could be leading a department tomorrow! Many of our team members have grown from entry-level positions to management roles.
‚úÖ Premium Insurance Coverage: We take care of our people with comprehensive health coverage.
‚úÖ Flexi Benefits: Travel, medical checkups, dental care (including braces & scaling), or even your favorite gadgets ‚Äì we‚Äôve got you covered.
‚úÖ Laptop Provided: Plus, we cover maintenance costs ‚Äì and if you‚Äôre lucky, you might get an upgrade!
‚úÖ Global Team: Collaborate with colleagues from Asia, MENA, and Latin America, with Europe on the horizon. Want to be part of our expansion journey?
‚úÖ Work From Anywhere Arrangement: If you‚Äôre the right fit, we trust you to deliver ‚Äì from anywhere in the world.

Get to know us:

At IUX, we are more than just a brokerage firm ‚Äì we are a global fintech powerhouse originally from Cyprus, with a presence spanning Asia, MENA, and Latin America. As we continue to expand into Europe and beyond, we are seeking top talent to join our dynamic team. Our mission? To revolutionize the trading experience through cutting-edge technology, seamless execution, and a client-centric approach. If you‚Äôre looking for a fast-paced environment where innovation meets opportunity, IUX is the place for you!

All applications will be treated in strict confidence. By submitting your application, you consent to our privacy policy regarding the collection and use of your personal data. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Du f√ºhrst Ad-hoc-Analysen durch, um die datengetriebenen Entscheidungsprozesse in allen Gesch√§ftsbereichen zu unterst√ºtzen

jobs.title: Data-Analyst (m/w/d) in SaaS-Startup (Remote / Hybrid)
jobs.description:
About the job
Wir sind cinify, ein junges Start-up, das den BI-Markt im Gesundheitswesen aufmischt. Unser Tool erm√∂glicht es Unternehmen, Daten aus verschiedenen Systemen zusammenzuf√ºhren, in Workflows zu integrieren und schlie√ülich in ansprechende Dashboards und Reports zu verwandeln. In deiner Rolle wirst du eng mit Kunden aus dem Gesundheitswesen zusammenarbeiten, ihre Anforderungen aufnehmen und mit deinen SQL-Kenntnissen ma√ügeschneiderte L√∂sungen entwickeln. Dabei bist du nicht nur technischer Umsetzer, sondern auch Projektmanager, der die Projekte eigenst√§ndig organisiert und zum Erfolg f√ºhrt.

Tipp: Auf unserer Webseite unter "Jobs" ist ein kleines Video unserer Data-Analysten zu dem Job. Schau dort am besten direkt mal vorbei!

Aufgaben
Als Data-Analyst bei cinify ist es Deine Aufgabe, komplexe Sachverhalte m√∂glichst greifbar und verst√§ndlich f√ºr unsere Kunden aufzubereiten.

Dabei wirst Du:


im direkten Kundenkontakt stehen, beraten und Kundenanforderungen direkt umsetzen.

Dashboards, Reports und Workflows erstellen.

Ideen zur Weiterentwicklung unserer Software einbringen.

Daten integrieren, validieren und optimieren.

im Team an Standardl√∂sungen f√ºr den Gesundheitsmarkt mitarbeiten.


Qualifikation
Um bei uns erfolgreich zu sein, bringst Du folgende Qualifikationen und F√§higkeiten mit:


Abgeschlossenes Studium und/oder erste Berufserfahrung im kaufm√§nnischen oder IT-Bereich

Routinierter Umgang mit SQL

Erfahrung mit BI-L√∂sungen wie PowerBI, Qlik oder Tableau

Datenaffinit√§t sowie die F√§higkeit komplexe Daten zu verstehen und ansprechend zu visualisieren

Selbst√§ndigkeit und Motivation zur Perfektionierung des eigenen Produktes

Ausgepr√§gte Kommunikations- und Teamf√§higkeit

Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift


Benefits

Falls gew√ºnscht EGYM-Wellpass und Corporate Benefits

Mitwirken bei der Gestaltung und Weiterentwicklung unserer innovativen BI-L√∂sung

Flexible Arbeitszeiten

Engagiertes, modernes und kreatives Arbeitsumfeld in einem aufstrebenden Start-up

ca. 1x im Quartal Team-Events (unsere letzten Team-Events: Weihnachtsmarkt, Escape-Room, VIP-Lounge Basketball Alba Berlin)

Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit 20% Zuschuss


Standort:

Unser B√ºro ist in Bochum. Der Gro√üteil des Teams ist aber Deutschlandweit aktiv. Unter anderem: Berlin, M√ºnchen, Stuttgart, Frankfurt und D√ºsseldorf.

Teamwork:

Unser Teamgeist ist uns besonders wichtig. Wir legen viel Wert auf gegenseitige Unterst√ºtzung und offene Kommunikation. Eine offene Fehlerkultur geh√∂rt bei uns dazu ‚Äì wir lernen aus Fehlern und wachsen gemeinsam daran. Wir sind kein Konzern mit starren Strukturen, sondern ein dynamisches Start-up, bei dem du direkten Einfluss auf den Erfolg des Unternehmens hast. Du gestaltest den Weg von cinify aktiv mit und siehst, wie deine Arbeit echten Impact hat. Wenn du eine Umgebung suchst, in der dein Beitrag z√§hlt und du gemeinsam mit uns wachsen m√∂chtest, dann bist du bei uns richtig. 

Ablauf der Bewerbung:

jobs.title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) ‚Äì Cloud Data & Analytics
jobs.description:
About the job
Ob IoT, ERP oder Streaming-Daten ‚Äì du verstehst, wie man aus komplexen Datenquellen klare Aussagen gewinnt? Dann gestalte mit uns datengetriebene L√∂sungen f√ºr den Mittelstand.

Als Data Analyst bei CmdScale analysierst du, modellierst und visualisierst Daten aus ERP-Systemen (z.‚ÄØB. SAP) und IoT-Quellen ‚Äì auf Plattformen wie Snowflake, Databricks und Microsoft Fabric. Gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden entwickelst du konkrete Use Cases entlang der Wertsch√∂pfungskette ‚Äì etwa in Produktion, Logistik oder Instandhaltung ‚Äì und √ºbersetzt Daten in steuerungsrelevante Informationen. Dabei bringst du nicht nur analytisches Know-how ein, sondern denkst die Datenarchitektur aktiv mit, arbeitest eng mit Engineers und DevOps zusammen und hilfst dabei, eine moderne, skalierbare Dateninfrastruktur aufzubauen.

Im Fokus stehen hier:

Datenplattformen beherrschen: Analyse, Modellierung und Visualisierung von Daten aus ERP und IoT
Insights generieren: Entwicklung von Abfragen, KPIs und Dashboards zur operativen Steuerung
Use Cases verstehen: Enge Zusammenarebit mit Kund:innen zur Entwicklung datengetriebener L√∂sungen
Cloud Analytics skalieren: Effektive Nutzung von Snowflake, Databricks und Fabric je nach Anwendungsfall
Architektur mitdenken: Unterst√ºtzung beim Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung unserer Dateninfrastruktur

Was dich bei uns erwartet

Direkte Einbindung in Projekte:

Bei uns steigst du nach einer fokussierten Onboarding-Phase direkt in spannende KI-Projekte ein ‚Äì mit echtem Gestaltungsspielraum. Du arbeitest mit Entwickler:innen, AI- und Cloud-Spezialist:innen zusammen und baust datenbasierte L√∂sungen f√ºr unsere Kunden aus dem industriellen Mittelstand.

Verantwortung & Freiheit:

Ob Analyse, Modellierung oder Visualisierung ‚Äì du entscheidest, wie du dein Ziel erreichst. Du arbeitest mit Snowflake, Databricks, Fabric und allem, was dein Werkzeugkasten sonst noch hergibt. Du bringst deine Ideen ein, entwickelst Best Practices mit ‚Äì und findest immer den effizientesten Weg zur L√∂sung.

Offene Unternehmenskultur: Du arbeitest in einem Umfeld, das von offener Kommunikation und dem Austausch von Ideen gepr√§gt ist. Wir tauschen uns leidenschaftlich √ºber Technologien und die neuesten Tech-Trends aus und wissen genau, wo wir die n√∂tigen Ressourcen f√ºr das n√§chste Projekt finden.. Du bist hier unter Gleichgesinnten, die sich gegenseitig unterst√ºtzen und weiterentwickeln, um das Beste aus sich herauszuholen.
Stark im Team: Bei uns bist du nie allein ‚Äì wir legen gro√üen Wert auf gegenseitige Unterst√ºtzung und ein starkes Team, in dem jeder dem anderen hilft, gemeinsam erfolgreich zu sein. Die CmdScaler arbeiten eng zusammen und unterst√ºtzen sich gegenseitig.
Flexibilit√§t: Wir bieten dir die Vielfalt und Freiheit, mehrere Projekte parallel zu bearbeiten oder zu wechseln. Wir passen die Projekte an dich an, sodass du deine St√§rken ausleben kannst. Genie√ü eine Work-Life-Balance, die du selbst planen kannst. Ob Nachteule oder Lerche - arbeite, wann immer du am besten performst oder was in dein Leben passt.
Sicherer Arbeitsplatz & faire Verg√ºtung:

Wir bieten dir eine unbefristete Vollzeitanstellung mit der Flexibilit√§t, remote aus ganz Deutschland oder in unserem M√ºnchener Office zu arbeiten.

F√ºr diese Rolle liegt die Gehaltsspanne zwischen 85.000‚ÄØ‚Ç¨ und 105.000‚Ç¨, aber deine Leistung ist uns jeden Cent wert ‚Äì wenn du mehr drauf hast, verdienst du auch mehr.

Deine Skill Checkliste

Fundierte SQL-Kenntnisse und Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit gro√üen Datenmengen
Erfahrung mit modernen Cloud-Datenplattformen, insbesondere Snowflake, Databricks und/oder Microsoft Fabric
Sicherer Umgang mit Visualisierungstools wie Power BI, Tableau, Looker oder vergleichbaren BI-Systemen
Kenntnisse in ETL-/ELT-Prozessen und Datenmodellierung (z.‚ÄØB. Star-/Snowflake-Schema, Data Vault)
Verst√§ndnis f√ºr ERP- und IoT-Daten ‚Äì idealerweise Erfahrung mit SAP-Systemen oder industriellen Datenquellen
Erste Erfahrung mit Scripting oder Analysen in Python oder R (z.‚ÄØB. f√ºr Datenaufbereitung, ML-Integration)
Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit strukturierten und semi-strukturierten Daten (z.‚ÄØB. JSON, Parquet, Delta Lake)
Kenntnisse in Cloud-Umgebungen, vorzugsweise Microsoft Azure
Selbstst√§ndige, strukturierte Arbeitsweise sowie ein gutes Gesp√ºr f√ºr Gesch√§ftsprozesse und Datenkontext
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse sowie gute Englischkenntnisse

Folgende Technologien haben wir auch oft bei uns im Einsatz

Diese √úbersicht gibt dir eine erste Orientierung. Wir freuen uns, wenn du bereits Erfahrung mit einigen dieser Tools gesammelt hast oder neugierig auf Neues bist.

Cloud & Datenplattformen:

Snowflake, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Google BigQuery, Azure Synapse, AWS Redshift

Visualisierung & BI:

Power BI, Tableau, Looker (Studio), Superset, Grafana

Tech Stack

GitLab CI, GitHub Actions

AWS. Azure

Deine Chance:

üë®‚Äçüíª Gelebte Remote-Kultur: Ob im Office in M√ºnchen, in deiner Heimat oder irgendwo anders in Deutschland - bei uns kannst du von √ºberall aus arbeiten.

üí∏ Variable Verg√ºtungsanteile werden flexibel durch einmalige Bonuszahlungen bei Zielerreichung oder durch Sales- und Consulting-Erfolge gew√§hrt, beispielsweise f√ºr Kundengewinnung, Potenzialerschlie√üung oder beschleunigte Projektabschl√ºsse.

üíª Hardware-Setup, wenn du f√ºr dein Homeoffice Setup noch etwas brauchst, sag uns gerne Bescheid, du kannst nat√ºrlich auch deine eigene Hardware nutzen.

üßë‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüßë Ein Team aus erfahrenen Expert:innen & Senior Engineers steht immer an deiner Seite, ob f√ºr den digitalen Kaffee am Nachmittag oder offene Fragen.

üëî Jede:r ist Teil des Managements: Mitarbeiter:innen haben alle die M√∂glichkeit, wichtige Entscheidungen zu treffen und das Unternehmen mitzugestalten.

üíõ Eine Kultur aus Verantwortung & Augenh√∂he ab der ersten Sekunde. Unabh√§ngig von Herkunft, Alter und Geschlecht sind wir ein Team, das sich zu 100% respektiert, klare Kommunikation pflegt und sich miteinander jederzeit Unterst√ºtzung zusichert.

üèãÔ∏è Urban Sports Club & Teamevents gibt es noch oben drauf, um sowohl deine Freizeit, als auch die Connection mit deinem Team nicht zu vernachl√§ssigen.

Ed

jobs.title: Internship - Data & Analytics (m/f/x)
jobs.description:
About the job
About FINN

FINN is an independent platform for car subscriptions from over 30 brands. Subscribe to a car with just a few clicks and it will be delivered directly to your doorstep in just a few days: FINN offers a carefree service and handles insurance, financing, registration, taxes and maintenance. FINN also funds climate action by supporting certified climate protection projects and thus offsets the carbon footprint of every vehicle of all drive types ‚Äì from production to every mile driven.

FINN was founded in Munich in 2019. The mission: to have a positive impact on people, organizations and the planet through frictionless mobility.

More Information: www.finn.com/

Your Role

As a Data Analytics Intern you will take responsibility for enabling FINN to make data-driven decisions. This includes taking on your own projects in making our objectives measurable or creating insightful analytics. You will also work at the intersection of Data and Business Development to drive initiatives based on the insights you gain. You will work with the most cutting edge tool stack available and can play a key role in establishing a data mindset in your team. You will work closely with the team, independently drive your projects and get the opportunity to contribute to a fast growing organization.

Your Benefits

This role is based in Munich with flexibility to work remotely a few times a week. Our modern offices feature frequent events with our great colleagues.
With massive growth potential, FINN allows you to quickly develop and succeed in a highly motivating startup environment with bold challenges in cross-functional teams.
Competitive fixed salary: 2.300‚Ç¨


Your Responsibilities

Move fast on your own projects: At FINN you will get responsibility from day one. All projects will have a critical and immediate impact on our company and the purpose to make mobility fun and sustainable.
Create actionable insights: Execute robust analyses, deliver actionable insights, make suggestions and support in implementing the measures across departments.
Critically question and improve existing processes: We constantly aim to build the best version of FINN. Help us to improve our existing setup with maximum efficiency by actively proposing improvements to current processes.
Become a data evangelist: Support your team to expand their analytical skills and educate them to become independent using and analyzing data with the tools that you learn to use (e.g. dbt, BigQuery, Looker).


Your Profile

Available for a full-time internship lasting 6 months.
Studying a business or engineering discipline with a focus on IT. A self-taught coding enthusiast is a great fit as well.
Experience in a high growth startup or another analytical, high-performance environment.
Experience working with SQL. Knowledge of other programming languages, e.g. Python, R, Java, is a plus.
Experience with Looker, Tableau (or other BI tools) is a plus.
Proactive, hands-on attitude and a natural curiosity about software & data tools.
Meticulous attention to detail and joy in precise working.
Highly analytical and comfortable around numbers.
Fluent in English.


Interested in Joining Our Fast-Growing Startup?

Please upload your CV and transcripts online. Carmen and Anna are looking forward to your application!

Equal Opportunities for Everyone

FINN is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are open to all groups of people without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

About Us:
Our mission at micro1 is to match the most talented people in the world with their dream jobs. If you are looking to be at the forefront of AI innovation and work with some of the fastest growing companies in Silicon Valley, we invite you to apply for a role. By joining the micro1 community, your resume will become visible to top industry leaders, unlocking access to the best career opportunities on the market.

Join micro1, a pioneer in connecting skilled remote professionals with leading Silicon Valley companies, as a Business Analyst. jobs.description:
About the job
Algorithmic Trader ‚Äì Crypto, FX & Arbitrage Strategies


An established and high-performing Crypto market maker is expanding. We're seeking an experienced Algorithmic Trader to join a lean, highly technical team composed of a Quant Developer and a Senior FX Trader. This is a rare opportunity to work at the intersection of crypto, OTC markets, and predictive modelling, with direct ownership over your strategies and systems.


What You‚Äôll Be Working On:
Designing and executing algorithmic trading strategies across crypto and FX markets
Hedging fiat exposures and managing OTC flow
Identifying and exploiting arbitrage opportunities across fragmented markets
Building and refining predictive models with real impact on trading decisions
Contributing to the robustness and scalability of hosting and infrastructure systems
Collaborating with a small team to iterate quickly and push high-performance strategies to production


What We‚Äôre Looking For:
Proven experience in algorithmic or systematic trading, ideally within OTC or high-frequency environments
Strong understanding of crypto markets, FX, or both ‚Äì especially in a proprietary trading context
Deep fluency in Python for both research and production
Hands-on experience with data modelling, back testing frameworks, and infrastructure hosting
Demonstrated success building trading systems from the ground up is a strong plus
Passion for markets, autonomy, and experimentation


What‚Äôs on Offer:
A performance-driven and low-bureaucracy environment
Highly competitive compensation, including profit share
Access to institutional-grade infrastructure with the agility of a startup
The chance to shape the future direction of a proven trading operation


This is a confidential role with flexible location arrangements for the right candidate. If you're passionate about building and scaling real trading systems, and thrive in fast, data-rich environments, send across your profile ASAP!

About the job
Job Description
ABOUT US
Since 2015, we‚Äôve been disrupting influencer and social media marketing like few other agencies. We are currently establishing ourselves as one of the largest social powerhouses in the DACH region. With over 210 social-first employees, two in-house studios, our own production company, proprietary social technology, and media channels with over 1 million followers, we are at the forefront of the industry.

With locations in Berlin, Hamburg, and Cologne, we specialize in creation, project management, consulting, social media, performance marketing, and (post-)production.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Data Analyst / Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in analyzing, managing, and working with our data sets and infrastructure. Your tasks will include:


Data Management & Optimization ‚Äì Take ownership of our data warehouse, ensuring high data quality, availability, and scalability.

Dashboard Development ‚Äì Support our teams and clients by developing and maintaining data dashboards that enable actionable insights.

Troubleshooting & Consulting ‚Äì Identify and resolve data issues while advising teams on best practices for data flows and architecture.

Collaboration with Client Teams ‚Äì Analyze the performance and effectiveness of social media brands, assets, and campaigns.

Lead Change through Data ‚Äì Present analytical results to internal and external stakeholders to enable data-driven decision-making.


Requirements
WHAT YOU BRING

We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst / Data Engineer with strong technical expertise and a passion for data-driven decision-making.

Must-Have Skills:

Proven experience with data processing, analysis, and warehouse management (ideally with BigQuery).

Experience with data modeling and analysis in a modern data warehouse environment and/or statistical software packages (e.g., R, SPSS, Stata, SAS).

Hands-on experience with data visualization (e.g., Looker Studio, Looker).

Experience with statistical analysis (e.g., regression analysis, A/B-testing)


Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience in eCommerce data structures and business intelligence workflows.

Programming skills (SQL, Python preferred)for data automation and workflow optimization.

Experience with large language models and machine learning techniques.


PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

Attention to Detail: You are highly analytical and love debugging complex data issues.

Strong Communicator: You can translate data insights into clear, actionable recommendations.

Language Skills: Fluent in German and proficient in English (written and spoken).


SOFT SKILLS

Transparent Communication: You proactively share insights and collaborate across teams.

Ownership Mentality: You take full responsibility for your projects and results.

Interdisciplinary Collaboration: You can translate complex data concepts for non-technical teams.

Empathy: You build strong relationships with stakeholders and team members.


WHAT WE OFFER YOU:

üí´ Our Benefits ‚Äì made for Mates.

Be the vibe.

Be the change.

Be a mate.

We believe: If you want to grow, you need space, energy, and people who support you. Our benefits provide exactly that.


üß≠ Stay flexible ‚Äì the way you need it:

Work should fit your life, not the other way around. With our hybrid model, you decide where you perform best ‚Äì in the office or remotely. And for true freedom:

You can work from any EU country for up to 6 weeks a year.

üéâ Moments that matter ‚Äì time that‚Äôs yours:

27 vacation days + your birthday off, because you‚Äôre worth it.

December 24th & 31st are on us ‚Äì for those special times with the people who matter most to you. 


We care. You celebrate.

üöÄ Move forward ‚Äì personally & professionally:

You want to grow? We‚Äôll make room for it: With a ‚Ç¨1,500 personal development budget per year, you can invest in what helps you move forward. 


Be the change ‚Äì we‚Äôll support you.

üí™ Maintain balance ‚Äì body, mind & energy:

Urban Sports Club subsidy to help you clear your head.

Nilo.health membership for when you need mental strength.

Because mates take care ‚Äì of themselves too.

üß° Your benefit. Your choice.

You decide what suits you best:

üí≥ Givve Card ‚Äì ‚Ç¨50 monthly for anything that makes your life better

üö≤ Mobiko ‚Äì ‚Ç¨65 for sustainable mobility

üíº Pension plan subsidy ‚Äì ‚Ç¨50 for your future

ü§ù Team spirit ‚Äì together we achieve more:

Regular team events, inspiring offsites, and a sense of togetherness you can feel.

Because ‚ÄúBe a mate‚Äù is more than just a phrase.

üíª A work environment with vibe:

High-quality equipment, stylish offices in Berlin, Hamburg, and Cologne.

Snacks, drinks & monthly team lunches ‚Äì because the best conversations often start in the kitchen.

jobs.title: Research Analyst
jobs.description:
About the job
Hi, we are Particula, the leading rating and monitoring platform for digital assets! Our mission? To make the market for digital assets more accessible, secure and transparent for institutional investors. We support issuers, trading facilities, banks and asset managers to create trust, minimize risks and allocate capital effectively. Join our team and shape the future of the financial world with us!

üëã About the Role

We are looking for a dedicated and experienced Analyst with solid experience in the financial industry to support the development and optimization of our rating and monitoring platform.

The ideal candidate (m/f/d) has 3-5 years of experience in the rating industry and has a strong interest in digital assets to take our ratings to the next level.

Aufgaben

Aggregating and analyzing data to gain meaningful insights and ensuring the accuracy and reliability of the data.

Prepare and write comprehensive rating reports, including conceptualization, data analysis and clear presentation of results.

Coordinate internal requirements and constraints with developers, marketing, sales and external partners to ensure product alignment with business objectives and customer needs.

Ensure that research activities and data aggregation meet the highest quality standards and comply with relevant laws and regulations.

Seek opportunities to continuously improve data collection, automation, analytics and reporting processes. Keep ahead of industry best practices.

Improve our holistic rating framework by ensuring the accuracy and relevance of metrics by analyzing market conditions and trends in digital assets.


Qualifikation

Proven experience in the financial sector, with a focus on credit ratings. (>3 years of experience).

Strong understanding of blockchain technology and tokenized assets.

Knowledge of data analytics and familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies.

In-depth knowledge of financial markets, investment strategies and regulatory frameworks for digital assets.

Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.

Proficient communication and writing skills in English.

Strong analytical skills to develop strategic plans based on market research and data insights.

Excellent problem solving skills and ability to adapt to new market trends and technological advances.


Benefits

Offsites with the team in exciting locations

Flexible working hours in a company that relies on remote work

Exciting product in a very dynamic market environment

Values-based start-up culture

Many opportunities to develop further and network with committed people

Flat hierarchy

Cash salary: gross annual salary & potential share options for outstanding performance

jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About the job
The company and our mission:

Zartis is a digital solutions provider working across technology strategy, software engineering, and product development.

We partner with firms across financial services, MedTech, media, logistics technology, renewable energy, EdTech, e-commerce, and more. Our engineering hubs in EMEA and LATAM are full of talented professionals delivering business success and digital improvement across application development, software architecture, CI/CD, business intelligence, QA automation, and new technology integrations.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to work on a project in the home energy optimization industry.


The project:

Our teammates are talented people that come from a variety of backgrounds. We‚Äôre committed to building an inclusive culture based on trust and innovation which creates a good work environment that helps enrich the product.
You will be part of a distributed team developing new technologies to solve real business problems.
Our client is a climate-tech startup on a mission to make rooftop solar more effective and affordable building a platform that optimizes home energy storage using real-time data and machine learning to reduce carbon emissions lower costs and make solar accessible to more households recently closed its seed round and rolling out to early users offering a remote-first setup with flexibility a small and ambitious team where early hires have real ownership and impact.

We are looking for someone proactive with strong communication skills and attention to detail, motivated by climate impact and data-driven solutions.

The Role:

We're looking for a Data Analyst to join our client‚Äôs founding team and take a leading role in how we manage, interpret, and leverage data across our client‚Äôs platform.

You'll work closely with engineering, product, and leadership to monitor and refine our optimisation models, deliver insights to enhance customer outcomes, and drive strategic decision-making. As one of our client‚Äôs first data-focused hires, you'll have significant autonomy and influence. You ºll work with the Head of Product to define best practices for data analysis and monitoring, design performance metrics, and work across technical and business domains to ensure that data remains a core strength of our client company.

What you will do:

Leading the analysis of large, complex time-series datasets from a range of sources (energy storage systems, home appliances, environmental data).
Monitoring the performance of our optimisation and forecasting models, proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.
Designing, implementing, and owning key performance indicators KPIs to track customer outcomes and system performance.
Rapidly diagnosing and investigating customer-facing or system issues using a data-driven approach.
Supporting and enhancing the development of new models for forecasting, optimisation, and predictive analytics.
Collaborating closely with engineering and product teams to turn analysis into action.
Providing input into business and product strategy based on data insights and emerging trends.
Helping to shape data processes, tooling, and culture as we scale.

What you will bring:

Ideally, 4 years of experience in a data analysis, data science, or analytics engineering role.
Advanced SQL skills and extensive experience working with relational databases (e.g., Cloud SQL, BigQuery).
Proficient in Python for data analysis Pandas, NumPy, Jupyter, etc.).
Significant experience working with complex time-series datasets.
Strong understanding of either linear optimisation techniques or machine learning for predictive analytics.
Demonstrated ability to translate complex datasets into actionable insights for technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving instincts and an intuitive grasp of real-world system behaviours reflected in data.
Self-directed and comfortable taking ownership in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative, low-ego approach.
Motivated by climate impact and passionate about building real-world solutions.

Nice to Have:

Experience working in energy systems/utilities or with smart/IoT devices.
Experience in early-stage startups or small cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with cloud-native data tooling (Google Cloud Platform preferred).
Experience establishing data monitoring and reporting frameworks from Scratch.

What we offer: 

100% Remote Work
WFH allowance: Monthly payment as financial support for remote working.
Career Growth: We have established a career development program accessible for all employees with a 360¬∫ feedback that will help us to guide you in your career progression.
Training: For Tech training at Zartis, you have time allocated during the week at your disposal. You can request from a variety of options, such as online courses (from Pluralsight and Educative.io, for example), English classes, books, conferences, and events.
Mentoring Program: You can become a mentor in Zartis or you can receive mentorship, or both.
Zartis Wellbeing Hub (Kara Connect): A platform that provides sessions with a range of specialists, including mental health professionals, nutritionists, physiotherapists, fitness coaches, and webinars with such professionals as well.
Multicultural working environment: We organize tech events, webinars, parties, and activities to do online team-building games and contests.
